docs.snippet: The Rev. Carlos Lopez-Acosta had seen the women's faces before at Sunday worship services and on Saturdays when they picked up two small children from religion instruction classes.   But on Friday evening there were no songs or prayers. The two...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Rev. Carlos Lopez-Acosta had seen the women's faces before at Sunday worship services and on Saturdays when they picked up two small children from religion instruction classes. But on Friday evening there were no songs or prayers. The two women, a mother and daughter team, one of them armed with a knife, ordered Father Lopez-Acosta to open the safe in his Bronx church, and they made off with about $1,500 in checks and cash from the church safe, the police said.

headline.main: 2 Women Rob Bronx Priest of $1,500 From Church Safe

docs.snippet: Ever since the Mexican Government devalued the peso in December, Argentina has insisted that it is not Mexico and will not face a similar crisis.   But tell that to Raul Manuel Garcia, a 32-year-old carpenter, whose employer is short on cash because...
docs.lead_paragraph: Ever since the Mexican Government devalued the peso in December, Argentina has insisted that it is not Mexico and will not face a similar crisis. But tell that to Raul Manuel Garcia, a 32-year-old carpenter, whose employer is short on cash because of a banking crisis that has raged in Argentina for weeks. "Every week," he said, "my boss tells me he can't pay because he needs more time, but it's been four weeks already, and I need money to pay my rent and buy food."

docs.snippet: Zambian Music With Wider Aspirations  Muriel Mwamba, singer Washington Square Church    Muriel Mwamba brought kalindula -- a breezy, syncopated, six-beat rhythm from Zambia -- to Washington Square Church on Saturday night, along with some crossover...
docs.lead_paragraph: Zambian Music With Wider Aspirations Muriel Mwamba, singer Washington Square Church Muriel Mwamba brought kalindula -- a breezy, syncopated, six-beat rhythm from Zambia -- to Washington Square Church on Saturday night, along with some crossover aspirations. Her band members were from Uruguay, the Dominican Republic and the United States; she sang in Bemba and in English, usually about love or positive thinking.

docs.snippet: TENNIS  Yzaga Upsets Becker  It was slow and damp yesterday at the German Open, and the conditions were not much different from Boris Becker's game. After losing in the clay court final at Monte Carlo, Monaco, last month, then in his first match at...
docs.lead_paragraph: TENNIS Yzaga Upsets Becker It was slow and damp yesterday at the German Open, and the conditions were not much different from Boris Becker's game. After losing in the clay court final at Monte Carlo, Monaco, last month, then in his first match at the BMW Open in Munich last week, the world's third-ranked player fell, 2-6, 6-2, 6-3, in the second round on the same surface in Hamburg to No. 52 Jaime Yzaga of Peru in a match twice delayed by rain. In other matches, ninth-seeded Wayne Ferreira of South Africa defeated Dmitri Poliakov of Ukraine, 6-2, 6-3, and Andrea Gaudenzi of Italy beat Marcelo Filippini of Uruguay, 4-6, 7-6 (8-6), 6-1. (AP)

headline.main: Japan Won't Take a Trade Back Seat Anymore

docs.snippet: After a pause during the spring presidential election campaign, French courts have resumed dealing with a wave of political corruption cases that have tainted all the major parties.   The conservative former Mayor of Nice, Jacques Medecin, was the...
docs.lead_paragraph: After a pause during the spring presidential election campaign, French courts have resumed dealing with a wave of political corruption cases that have tainted all the major parties. The conservative former Mayor of Nice, Jacques Medecin, was the latest to be sentenced, receiving a two-year jail term and a $40,000 fine today for milking his city's civic opera association of $400,000 in the 1980's. He had been Mayor for 25 years but fled to Uruguay in 1990 after being charged with funneling nearly $3 million to a personal bank account in Los Angeles.

docs.snippet: HARRY MITCHELL, the BOC single-handed sailor who has been missing at sea since March 2, was honored by a gathering of BOC sailors, officials, friends and race supporters Tuesday night in Charleston, S.C. Present were the seaman's wife, DIANA...
docs.lead_paragraph: HARRY MITCHELL, the BOC single-handed sailor who has been missing at sea since March 2, was honored by a gathering of BOC sailors, officials, friends and race supporters Tuesday night in Charleston, S.C. Present were the seaman's wife, DIANA MITCHELL, and son, PAUL. Mitchell was racing from Sydney, Australia, to Punta del Este, Uruguay, when an emergency distress signal was activated aboard the 70-year-old skipper's 40-foot Henry Hornblower about 1,500 miles west of Cape Horn.

headline.main: Ceremony Held for Missing BOC Sailor

docs.snippet: At the annual meeting of the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development here, one of the major players turned out to be not a member of this select club of 25 rich nations but an invited guest.    As Renato Ruggiero, the Director General...
docs.lead_paragraph: At the annual meeting of the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development here, one of the major players turned out to be not a member of this select club of 25 rich nations but an invited guest. As Renato Ruggiero, the Director General of the new World Trade Organization, went from meeting to meeting, he had to fight his way through the crush of television cameras.

headline.main: Fledgling World Trade Arbiter Listens to the War Cry of Giants

docs.snippet: Entranced by visions of barges piled high with sugar, soy and wheat, Latin American businesses are pressing for construction of a 2,000-mile-long waterway that they say would be South America's liquid spinal cord.    The project, called the Hidrovia,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Entranced by visions of barges piled high with sugar, soy and wheat, Latin American businesses are pressing for construction of a 2,000-mile-long waterway that they say would be South America's liquid spinal cord. The project, called the Hidrovia, or waterway, would speed shipping by straightening and deepening the Paraguay and Parana Rivers. It would open an outlet to the sea for Paraguay and Bolivia and would help the region's new Southern Common Market. The waterway, which could cost as much as $1 billion, would also run through parts of Brazil, Argentina and Uruguay.

headline.main: Asuncion Journal; A 2,000-Mile Highway of Water for Commerce

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: WATERWAYS AND OTHER BODIES OF WATER
